Text:
A while after I was given the name
Alpha...
Right on time. Give me your report.

I've got intel on a village said to have been
destroyed by the possessed.
The possessed? Our kind...

Under the curse, magic becomes impossible to control,
causing the body to erode into a mound of flesh.

Those who fall victim to this curse are known as
"the possessed" and are treated akin to demons.

The possessed are not worthy of living—I myself
believed that until he saved me.

In fact, susceptibility to the curse is proof one is
descended from heroes. Association of the
possessed with demons was spread by the
Cult of Diablos.

Yes... Shadow saved me, and he taught me the truth of
the hidden world.

If the possessed are on a rampage, the Cult won't
sit by idly. I'm sure they'll send in troops to capture
them.

True. From the Cult's perspective, the possessed
going berserk would be something they'd want to
deal with swiftly.

On top of that, if the possessed really are behind
this, they could become assets to the Garden once
they're cured...right?
...Exactly.

Zeta's eyes are fixed on me, yet her gaze
occasionally seems elsewhere.

She looks past me, observing something far beyond.
This is why I sometimes wonder if I can trust her.

But we are all descendants of heroes—in other words,
distant relatives. As family, I want us to look after
each other.

Besides, just because we're family doesn't mean we
always have to be on the same page.
Alright, let's go ask our lord to accompany us—
That won't be necessary.

What? I thought he was the only one who could cure
the possessed...

I've learned the cure for the curse. I'll do the
curing this time.

...Sounds risky. You've never actually performed the
cure before, have you?

No. That's why, to be safe, I'm thinking of having
you and Beta accompany me to the village.

If it were just for backup, you'd be more than enough
as my guide.

But you'd like extra firepower in case the Cult
decides to show up.

Zeta sometimes attempts to anticipate my thought
process, as if she can see right through me.

Beta—at least as she is now—is the type who just
follows orders to the letter.

Not Zeta—she has a mind of her own and responds to
circumstances on the fly.

They're opposites, but that's good. Similar minds
leave little room to think outside the box.
That's right. Now please go get Beta.

Sure thing! Did you know Beta gets real mad if you
walk into her room without knocking?

No one likes someone silently walking in on them. You
really should stop hiding your presence and sneaking
into people's rooms.

It's an occupational habit. Can't be fixed that
easily.

Zeta waves her hand with a flutter and disappears
into the night.
...Whew.
Once I'm sure she's gone, I catch my breath.

Although we may be family, as the leader of this
organization, the Shadow Garden, I prefer to avoid
displaying any signs of weakness.
Not just around Zeta, but Beta and Delta as well.
Will I really be able to cure the possessed?
As I let my guard down, the words spill from my lips.

There's no denying I share Zeta's apprehension.
This will be my first time, after all.

Excluding my own experience, I've observed each
occasion where Shadow cured one of the
possessed.

I know how to do it. I've done it in my mind countless
times. But this time, it will be real, and—
If I fail...

An image of myself, a mangled mound of flesh, forces
its way into my mind.
Never again. No one should have to experience that.

There's a first time for everyone. I can't afford to
let fear get the best of me.
Otherwise, many more will end up as I once was.

Besides, if I can't establish the cure and teach it
to the others, then the Garden's expansion will—
I fall silent as I hear footsteps approach my room.

As Shadow's second-in-command, I can't worry the
others... I've got to pull myself together.
There you are, Beta.
Zeta's filled me in on the general plan.

In that case, I'll keep it brief so listen closely.
You'll be the backup—

Thus, my first time attempting to cure the possessed
draws nearer.
